result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler L. Geiwitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo domestic abuse assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment recommended within 9 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall successfully complete parenting classes through The Parenting Place for ages 0-6 within 9 months of the agreement and provide proof to the Justice Department Coordinator or designee.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.
Obtain and maintain full time employment in an occupation suitable to agent.  May not voluntarily quit employment without agent approval.

Comply with any conditions, assessments and no contacts per agent.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

If agent believes domestic violence or anger management programming is suitable, then agent may order.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
